text:
Image zoom Neil Rasmus/BFA/REX/Shutterstock

It’s hard to imagine Kerry Washington as anything other than a glamorous star, but her situation is sometimes very relatable to most parents.

The Scandal star sat down with Net-A-Porter for their magazine The Edit‘s most recent cover story, and took some time between political discussion — both real-life and small-screen — to dish on her life as a working mom.

“I can be covered in spit-up on a conference call while I’m pumping and that’s okay, because this is my perfect,” she says, breastfeeding her 7-month-old son Caleb Kelechi during the interview.

Adds the actress, 40, “It may not be somebody else’s, but this is mine.”

Want all the latest pregnancy and birth announcements, plus celebrity mom blogs? Click here to get those and more in the PEOPLE Babies newsletter.

RELATED VIDEO: It’s Kerry Washington’s 40th Birthday — Let’s Look Back at Her Transformation

Washington and her husband, 35-year-old former San Francisco 49ers cornerback Nnamdi Asomugha, are also parents to daughter Isabelle Amarachi, 3. And when it comes to balance, the four-time Emmy-nominated star says she taps into her Scandal character Olivia Pope for inspiration.

“We will not fail. We will not go down. We will fight the fight. There’s always a solution,” she says, adding that the words have “sapped into [her] bloodstream” after she has said them so many times.

“Now I feel that way,” Washington shares. “I wake up, I have a house full of kids and pets, a new production company, I’m number one on the call sheet, and I think: ‘I will not go down. There’s always another way.’ “

FROM PEN: Supermodel Christie Brinkley is 63 and back in SI‘s Swimsuit Issue with Her Daughters!

One person who helps her keep her goals in line? Scandal showrunner Shonda Rhimes, who is a known supporter of working moms across her many projects.

“Shonda’s got I-don’t-know-how-many shows now, plus three kids, and she just figures it out,” Washington explains. “However busy I feel, Shonda feels busier, so I’m just going to rise to the occasion.”

Adds the star, “She’s been a real role model. Seeing the community she’s created and the work ethic – I feel like there should be more of this in the world.”
title: Working Mom Kerry Washington Talks Being 'Covered in Spit-Up on a Conference Call' While Pumping: 'This Is My Perfect'
